arch:property.oc:show_val:
This locus is a pot holder, located SE of L145 and approximately 0.5m west of the east trench baulk. its surface is lined with bright orange-pink pot sherds and mud, forming a concave shape depression. Max. depth: 0.12m
THE FOLLOWING DESCRIPTION SHOULD BE ENTERED IN THE LOCUS FEATURE DESCRIPTION FORM, HOWEVER, SYSTEM RETURNS ERROR: This feature is a pit filled with small pot sherds (bright orange in color, some burnt), pebbles, and packed with dirt. A single bone is recovered from the fill. A fragment of a ground stone was collected from the surface (top of the pot stand). Lithic debitage present also.
the top of this feature is on the same elevation as the adjacent L145 (melted oven/kiln)--possible relation?
round, concave pit filled with small pottery sherds, ash, and dirt, some small rocks

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area D / Trench 8 / Locus 157 (Locus)
